courses.title: Introduction to Linguistics
courses.description: Introductory course that surveys various fields in linguistics, including first/second language acquisition, phonetics/phonology, morphology/syntax, semantics/pragmatics, language variation, computational linguistics/natural language processing, and writing systems.  Credit not allowed for both LING 2100 and LING 2001.

courses.title: Advanced Language Processing
courses.description: This flexible course explores computational-, psycho-, or corpus linguistics (depending on instructor expertise).  Students read/present academic articles, process data using Python/R/Qualtrics, and pursue original projects.

courses.title: Language & Computers
courses.description: A linguistic perspective on language processing topics (search, vector semantics, document classification, digital humanities, translation, dialog). Students read current literature and implement concepts in Python.
